section.name: Overview
section.p: Welcome to the MevenIDE IDEA Integration project! This project aims to integrate Maven in every possible way into JetBrain's IntelliJ IDEA integrated development environment (IDE).

Current integration features include:
An initial POM graphical and text editors (still in progress). The editors are synchronized with changes from outside the IDE, as well as inside the IDE.
Specifying a POM file on a per-module basis.
An Ant-like tool window displaying each IDEA module's available goals, as defined in the project or module's maven.xml.
Execution of selected goal(s) in a dedicated execution console, much like the standard Runconsole of IDEA. Each execution can be stopped or paused, and output can be copied and exported.
Specifying a different Maven home than the one defined in your MAVEN_HOMEenvironment variable and PATH, as well as auto-detection of your Maven home (via the MAVEN_HOME variable).

The following is a (partial) list of features we intend to be implementing over the coming months:
Bidirectional update between IDEA project and POM
A wizard for opening+creating IDEA project from a POM
Autolaunch goals on specific project events (compilation, etc)
Automatic artifact downloading on need (on project open?)
Browinsg of both remote and local repositories, as well as manually downloading artifacts to the local repository. Searching the repositories for an artifact is also planned.
POM text file editor (instead of the UI editor) with smart intellisense.
Jelly script file editor with smart intellisense.
Goal searching based on text, dependencies, etc.
A wizard for creating a POM from an existing IDEA project.
A POM strucutre tree.
POM templates.
For a full list - please see our tasks page.

section.name: Help Wanted!
section.p: The Mevenide IDEA integration project is quite new and needs volunteers - you can help! If you like the IntelliJ IDEA IDE, and you like Maven - come and help us write the best IDEA plugin yet - the Maven plugin!
To participate - please contact us via our mailing lists or contact the project lead here.

section.name: Availability
section.p: Currently, no version has been released yet. The 0.1 release is well underway and should be released in the coming weeks. Until then, you are more than welcome to try the snapshot build located here. To install it - simply unzip it into your IDEA plugins directory.

section.name: Compatibility
section.p: Currently the plugin is only supported on the IntelliJ IDEA Early Access Program (EAP) dubbed "Irida". It cannot be run on the 4.5 version.

There is, however, a port of the plugin for the 4.5 version with provides the basic features such as per-module POM attachment, favorite goals, running goals and jumping to source code from Maven error messages. It is available here.
NOTE: This is a source code distribution, and you will have to build it from source code. If you do, make sure you compile the classes using IDEA, since the plugin utilizes the IDEA UI designer, which injects bytecode into the classes. There is an Ant script inside, but it does not perform the code injection, and you will get exceptions. The Ant script DOES, however, provide an Ant task for it, but does not activate it.
